amendment.description: Amendment to provide $7 million for the Chesapeake Bay Oyster Restoration program run by the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers to enhance water quality and fisheries productivity in the bay, offset by a reduction of $7 million in funding for Army Corps of Engineers Expenses.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 2 printed in Part A of House Report 111-209 to provide $7 million for the Chesapeake Bay Oyster Restoration program run by the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers to enhance water quality and fisheries productivity in the bay, offset by a reduction in funding for Army Corps of Engineers Expenses.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Connolly (VA) amendment (A002) Agreed to by recorded vote: 362 - 69 (Roll no. 544).
